intro: Cephalophorus chrysacanthus, commonly known as the golden cup-mudplantain, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky, arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and threatened species in its native range.
